page.title: 04BARNHAM 2
page.content:
(Continued from page 3) The Post Office used to be under the bridge.It is now in Barnham Square. This means that it is not so far to walk. Mrs Barsby can think of only one adverse change in Barnham: the bus service which used to be very good has now almost completely disappeared. There used to be only a few houses along the main Barnham Road but the new estate in the north of the area has greatly increased the population. A large grocer's shop has taken over from the "fish and chip shop". This shop extends from the "Chinese shop" to the estate agent. Mrs Barsby enjoys living in Barnham. She thinks that the changes that have been made are for the better.
By Elizabeth Binns and Louise Dodd.
